head.title: Over Their Dead Bodies: How Their Stores Will Go Online

hedline.hl1: Over Their Dead Bodies: How Their Stores Will Go Online

block.p: SOMEDAY, the Web may indeed change everything. But for right now, more than 80 percent of small businesses are getting along without a Web site, and only 7 percent are selling goods online, according to a recent survey conducted by the National Federation of Independent Businesses in Washington. Owners of the 1,055 businesses surveyed cited concerns about cost, lack of technical expertise and losing the personal touch that they see as vital to their businesses. Our informal survey of small-business holdouts in the New York City area reflected the same concerns, phrased rather more colorfully.
